name: whang
content:
whang verb
(HIT OR THROW)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ T ] mainly UK to hit or throw something using force: She whanged the ball to the ground in disgust. On his first day back at school he opened the door and wanged a shoe violently across the classroom.
More examplesFewer examples He collected the ball and, without looking, whanged a return into his opponent.Howard lifted his tattooed arm and whanged a chord on his green electric guitar.

whang verb
(MOVE)
[ I +adv/prep ] UK to move or drive fast, often making a loud noise: The rear of the car nudged out towards the wrong side of the road as we whanged round the bend. At the Jazzfest power chords whanged around the concrete canyons of the city. The two birds went wanging off in different directions.
More examplesFewer examplesA bullet whanged off his dashboard, smashing his one and only compass.The player sent a ball whanging at the ceiling and shouted at the umpire.
